snippet: The March deficit of $40.4 billion reflected a rebound in exports, the Commerce Department reported.
abstract: Commerce Departmernt reports that United States trade deficit narrowed in March as exports rebounded to second-highest level on record, led by strong gains in sales of aircraft, autos and farm goods; deficit declined to $40.4 billion, down 3.6 percent from revised February imbalance of $41.9 billion.
lead_paragraph: The March deficit of $40.4 billion reflected a rebound in exports, the Commerce Department reported.

headline.main: U.S. Exports Climb 2.1%, and Trade Deficit Narrows
headline.print_headline: U.S. Exports Climb 2.1%, and Trade Deficit Narrows
